intro: Antirrhinum lazari, commonly known as the Lazari Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy blooms from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. Antirrhinum lazari is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
